notes: reflexive verb of 'fingere'; uses auxiliary essere; past participle 'finto'
example_sentence_english: To pretend to be sick is wrong.
He saved himself by pretending to be a tourist.
I pretended to be sick.
I pretended to be distracted.
We pretended to be students.
We pretended to be guides.
I pretend to be busy on the phone.
You pretend to be an expert in wine.

translation_english: he pretends to be/she pretends to be/you (formal) pretend to be
notes: reflexive form; also used as formal 'Lei'
example_sentence_english: He pretends to be interested.
We pretend to be tourists.
You pretend to be friends.
They pretend to be innocent.
As a child I used to pretend to be sick.
You used to pretend to be tired every evening.

translation_english: he was pretending to be/she was pretending to be/you (formal) were pretending to be
notes: reflexive form; also used as formal 'Lei'
example_sentence_english: He used to pretend to be happy at work.
We used to pretend to be rich for fun.
You used to pretend to be foreigners.
They used to pretend to be busy.
I have pretended to be sick.
I have pretended to be sick.
You have pretended to be an expert.
You have pretended to be an expert.

translation_english: he has pretended to be/she has pretended to be/you (formal) have pretended to be
notes: used with auxiliary essere; also used as formal 'Lei'
example_sentence_english: He has pretended to be busy.

translation_english: he has pretended to be/she has pretended to be/you (formal) have pretended to be
notes: used with auxiliary essere; also used as formal 'Lei'
example_sentence_english: She has pretended to be busy.
We have pretended to be students.
We have pretended to be students.
You have pretended to be tourists.
You have pretended to be tourists.
They have pretended to be sick.
They have pretended to be sick.
